content: bring it on pumpkin psl pumpkin pie pumpkin carving you can t spell autumn without well nvm my point is autumn would be boring without this gorgeous bulbous fruit in our pastries on our stoops and decorating our mantles i ve been having a blast playing around with patterns shapes and textures but i think i definitely have a favorite the affectionately named lumpy pumpkin in our sultan singles base i am just enamored with the way the singly ply chunky yarn knits up and the little pumpkin lumps are so preciou s and quick to whip up which if you know me you ll know if it isn t quick then it s never happening 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 1 the beauty of these pumpkin patterns besides being so cute is that they are totally customizable there s almost no wrong way to make these little guys the possibilities are practically endless for example you can - cast on any number of stitches you want - knit as many row as you d like - use any weight of yarn or base you fancy - flip the tube inside out for a purled pumpkin - use up your scraps - marled pumpkins in these patterns i ve suggested a stitch count to go with chunky/bulky weight yarn but don t let that stop you from experimenting with your stash i d love to see your pumpkins feel free to tag me in you makes or use any of our hashtags so i can see you work - @hawaribazaaryarnco on instagram - #hawaribazaar #hawaribazaaryarn #hawaribazaardesigns i hope you enjoy whipping up these fun little pumpkins corinne 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 2 tips and thoughts regarding construction - the decrease row aren t necessary you could totally just knit a tube and i like to use the cast on edge as the top of my cinch both ends it would be a great pumpkin i like the way the fabric gathers beginner project making it look more pumpkin-like with little effort from the knitter lol some people like to hot glue their twigs and sticks in place but i just tighten the edge i when making the pumpkins i like to add haven t had a problem yet but it s something to decrease row for the bottom to help them sit consider better it also makes it easier to close up but make sure you knit these row slightly tighter than the rest of your pumpkin to reduce any gaps made from looser stitches when picking a stalk there are a few different options you can pick from when selecting your pumpkin s stalk - twigs and sticks - cinnamon sticks - knit i-cord - rolled felt twigs and cinnamon sticks add a cute rustic look to the knitted pumpkins i especially love the look of rough-edged tree twigs but they all look really cute in the end i -
